2.2.0RC5 

Now that 104727 is fixed ...

If an ecore file lacks the xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" declaration the following NPE results as a type="ecore:EDataType http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString" attribute is processed.

Thread [Worker-0] (Suspended (exception NullPointerException))

Ed,

I can't reproduce this.  I get exceptions like this:

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl$1$DiagnosticWrappedException: org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.ClassNotFoundException: Class 'EPackage' not found. (platform:/resource/lib/model/library.ecore, 5, 63)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl.handleDemandLoadException(ResourceSetImpl.java:307)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl.demandLoadHelper(ResourceSetImpl.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl.getResource(ResourceSetImpl.java:390)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.presentation.EcoreEditor.createModelGen(EcoreEditor.java:1017)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.presentation.EcoreEditor.createModel(EcoreEditor.java:1038)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.presentation.EcoreEditor.createPages(EcoreEditor.java:1113)
	at org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditorPart.createPartControl(MultiPageEditorPart.java:275)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.createPartHelper(EditorReference.java:596)

Could you please provide a specific sample file with this problem or other steps that will definitely produce this behavior?  I don't understand how processing will get beyond the EPackage itself so I don't know how to cause this problem to happen.  It might depend on which JDK you are using or other options you might have set...

Created an attachment (id=42540)
Repro

Opening the attached in the much improved Sample Ecore Editor shows the same
top 9 levels of stack trace in a simpler context than I originally had.

(There are plenty of stupidities in the attached example.)

Created an attachment (id=42566)
The results that I see...

For this file, it also doesn't get past the unrecognized data at the root.
The following does generate a problem just like you report:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0"
    xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="a"
    nsURI="a" nsPrefix="a">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="A">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="x" eType="ecore1:EClass x.ecore#//A"/>
  </eClassifiers>
</ecore:EPackage>

so that's the test case I will fix.  (Note the ecore1:EClass.)
An additional null guard check has been committed to CVS.
